topic.title: EulerFinder feedback
topic.body:
EulerFinder is a Zeronet search engine, leave your feedback here!
http://127.0.0.1:43110/13eFkhbXXQcJqd729zRLL9tMxxhz9d4UA6/

topic.title: If in Zirch your search the word: "test" cpu and ram will go to 100%

1509624447_1CGweCTCsFxD5FjvciBaGagZXsAUb.body:
> [michaelwesten](#comment_9_1AqnMR6NZXT6cZ1dgpnhx5pfeFvPQ1edU6): Please change the returned search results from a link like 127.0.0.1:43110/1whatever to /1whatever. Some people use different port numbers, some use different protocol headers, some proxies aren't configured correctly... [...]

Thanks for the feedback, fix done :)

> [gitcenter](#comment_4_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Could you please add EulerFinder to Git Center?

There isn't a file upload option?

> [gitcenter](#comment_5_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): In Git Center, you mean?

yep

> [gitcenter](#comment_7_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): But you can create plain-text files via copy-paste.

Yes but it's not the best way, i will wait that feature ;)

> [gitcenter](#comment_8_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/1509719565

seem not working, i can select the file, but don't seem upload it, maybe I'm wrong something

> [gitcenter](#comment_10_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): What OS/browser are you using? Does something appear in Console?

Console nothing, Arch Linux chromium

> [qubesi2p](#comment_4_17wjH4ZhSZ23kjERdp1GnnTuc92kKUQgm4): The following SEARCH RESULTS contain MALWARE or were hijacked when they refer to i2p!If you are found injecting MALWARE into your Search RESULTS especially those referring i2p it will not be taken kindly by i2p community in general.  If you have a problem with i2p just say so in your general opinion page!  Do I need to be more specific? [...]

I don't understand your problem, where are malware?

1CBrU7hWzeQERoBWyjrGUJckjHutLkPm26 is a void index
1EQuaziF7F3ovnEmXjDc9UrgjfWMTUMKqF have no peer
zeroblog.bit have a wrong name i will correct it

This is the page for report, please explain it better thanks: http://127.0.0.1:43110/13eFkhbXXQcJqd729zRLL9tMxxhz9d4UA6/ReportSite.html

> [gitcenter](#comment_11_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): And after pressing Upload and commit nothing changes? Does window like Select file appear?

nope, yes it appear

> [gitcenter](#comment_14_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Could you check if it works under some other browsers? I cannot reproduce your issue.

same firefox
> [gitcenter](#comment_15_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): After pressing Upload and commit, nothing happens. And if you manually open file list after that, that file isn't listed? it's not

> [gitcenter](#comment_18_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): And does creating file, not uploading, work?

the file not appear, now please stop spam

> [krixano](#comment_131_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Uh, how is he spamming?!?


flood*

> [krixano](#comment_133_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): And regardless, why report bugs if your not going to follow up on questions to help fix the bug?

yes, but not here, simple.

> [krixano](#comment_135_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): And the purpose of ZeroTalk is communication, so I think your being really dumb right now.

Yes talk, but i've open this talk for another purpose, he can simple open another talk.

> [krixano](#comment_136_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Electronic spamming is the use of electronic messaging systems to send an unsolicited message (spam), especially advertising, as well as sending messages repeatedly on the same siteUnsolicited - not asked for, given, done voluntarilly [...]

blame? wtf, i asked to stop the discussion because it's become very long, he can create a new talk about Git-Center and i will help him, I did not think that needed any explanation.

> [krixano](#comment_139_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Not only that, but you could have created a new topic when you reported the bug, but instead you said this in this topic:seem not working, i can select the file, but don't seem upload it, maybe I'm wrong something

Krixano now same, ok my answer was not be the best and i want not blame anyone, now we can stop this discussion? Please i wanna take this talk for feedback.

> [krixano](#comment_142_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): BTW, it looks like you have some duplicates in your search engine. When typing in ZeroMedium, I get 4 different addresses, 3 of which are essentially the same.

zeromedium.bit and 1CVmbCKWtbskK2GAZLM6gnMuiL6Je25Yds are right,
others, yes thanks for the report, i will fix

> [rubit](#comment_14_18sV4LF2Q372BLkTJN5Z24HeRexQQscx1E): Is it possible to also search the content of zites?

subpage index? Not now, should increase the database too, but I will add this feature in the future, maybe in a clone site where test it.
Now the site need bugs fix.

> [krixano](#comment_142_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): BTW, it looks like you have some duplicates in your search engine. When typing in ZeroMedium, I get 4 different addresses, 3 of which are essentially the same.

Fixed
Update: http://127.0.0.1:43110/13eFkhbXXQcJqd729zRLL9tMxxhz9d4UA6/CpuContribute.html

> [andreamarini](#comment_10_1MYPi2rwymqQag8yxPGzJgSe591yp2xHak): it seems great

Grazie :D
indexing bug fix

> [krixano](#comment_148_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): I can't find a website for what your using for Cpu Contribute (is that the name of what your using?). Can you link it?

`What is cpu contribute? Cpu contribute is your contribute for the site maintenance and updates,`

.....

`it's a little return of money for the developer work and it's free for you.`

You are free to disable it.
Update: your cpu contribute setting is saved in config.json file and you will not set it each time you load the page.
Update: indexing bug fix

> [krixano](#comment_150_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Notice how I didn't ask What is Cpu contribute? You should probably read my actual question: can't find a website for **what you are using** for cpu contribute. I also said if that was the name for what you are using (because as previously mentioned, I can't find a website). Meaning - are you using a library that runs a script in the background, are you linking to something else on the internet that runs? I'm asking what is the website where you can get this library/script/whatever. for example bigcat.tk uses CoinHive. Is that what you are using? Are you using something else?

ohw sorry, yes i'm using coinhive.

> [akito](#comment_362_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): @axeltherabbit I sent you a message.

Sorry for the late reply
Update: EulerFinder update sites list each hour.

> [krixano](#comment_161_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): I noticed something. When I type ZeroMedium, I get two results. Are these being counted as two seperate zites for the zite counter? If it is, I feel like it shouldn't do that because then your counter's incorrect. Also, I think it would be better to just show 1 result with both links.

because .bit sites should have expiration date, yes maybe I should get them together but i'm working to another update now (store number of peers for each site, to put the best sites on the top results)

> [krixano](#comment_162_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): relevance

what type of relevance?

> [krixano](#comment_163_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Uh... relevance to your search query.

Yes, but i can't update a file for each click, you know how 0net work

> [krixano](#comment_164_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): You don't need to update any file. Just sort the results based on how many words from the query match.

then this, yes it's possible

> [kopyjane](#comment_76_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): You need to choose from one or the other. Both of these scripts are the same, except authedmine.min.js asks for permission from the user (which should be standard practice if you want Coinhive to survive as a viable source of online revenue.) If you put both of them at once, it'll confuse the browser..  [...]

Ok thanks for your time :), i will check later.

> [kopyjane](#comment_76_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): You need to choose from one or the other. Both of these scripts are the same, except authedmine.min.js asks for permission from the user (which should be standard practice if you want Coinhive to survive as a viable source of online revenue.) If you put both of them at once, it'll confuse the browser..  [...]

You are right, i've removed: 
`<script sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-scripts" src="https://authedmine.com/lib/authedmine.min.js"></script> `.

why not ` <script sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-scripts" src="https://coinhive.com/lib/coinhive.min.js"></script> `?
because i've made a permission system that remember user choice
gitcenter repo: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1MnH9K7GnHpyhNwYRVMWAwkTmKfhQCpfvN

> [krixano](#comment_167_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Your repo is still bugged. You need to completely redo it. I'm not sure how, but you can ask gitcenter: or glightstar:

you can't see files?

> [krixano](#comment_168_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): I see a directory with no name, which isn't supposed to be allowed I believe. If you're getting something different, could you try clicking the "sign and publish" button (again)?

ohw i've never click there lol

> [axeltherabbit](#comment_49_1CGweCTCsFxD5FjvciBaGagZXsAUbXustF): ohw i've never click there lol

should be ok now.

> [krixano](#comment_169_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Yeah, you have to click that every time you change something in the repo (including all commits). If you're using git from the command line, gitcenter: did create a git hook thing that will automatically do this for you, but I don't know if he updated it to only use private key at the same time he updated that blue "sign and publish" button to only use the private key.Anyways, I see more files now, but there is still that directory with no name.

me too, idk what is it.

> [krixano](#comment_170_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): It happens when you go to upload a file and start the path with a "/". gitcenter: fixed this recently I believe.

i can't remove it

> [krixano](#comment_172_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): You said your search engine is automated, like Zirch, right? Does your search engine fetch from ZeroSites also or does it only do 0list?

also

1509789326_1BgmsWcEitkkf96t5qVkBFPoYwdoc.body: I'm testing it, seems work very well, thanks, maybe a goodnews for zeronet community

1510250312_1CGweCTCsFxD5FjvciBaGagZXsAUb.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_204_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The proxy is working for me.

yes now work

1509649171_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_30_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): @axeltherabbit You made EulerFinder, right? I see your repository is corrupted: it has zero-length filenames. How did you manage to do that?


i think during the attempts of trying the file upload feature

1510936767_1CGweCTCsFxD5FjvciBaGagZXsAUb.body:
> [jlxip](#comment_44_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C): Shit you're right. I'll have a look at the code and see what it's doing.

Are you a dev of the site?

> [jlxip](#comment_45_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C): Of course not. But every Zite is open-source. In fact, the source code is in your machine at the moment.

yes i know

> [gitcenter](#comment_32_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): I use Firefox Quantium and it doesn't!

do it with firefox 57 and opera for me

1512159205_1NpjJ6CEfGa7sDx2VHEEnwrpiy8DX.body:
> [krixano]
`but I'm unsure on how many zites it actually has.` it is write, in this moment: 3892
`EulerFinder look decent/okay ` i know ahahaI'm not a good graphic :D
`I'm unsure about the searching of EulerFinder but it seems similar to zirch` yep similar, it use an automate script but i can edit site description and name, for requests: http://127.0.0.1:43110/13eFkhbXXQcJqd729zRLL9tMxxhz9d4UA6/EditSite.html

> [krixano](#comment_160_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): I actually updated my comment a little bit ago to be more accurate:

i see thanks

> [gitcenter](#comment_49_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Light theme/adjuster for EulerFinder: http://127.0.0.1:43110/16miC8x9cWWLVxfb8v1mbAvecfXRitwuLj. It even somewhat works with BinChan's dark theme.

upload bug of gitcenter seem solved :)

the repo:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1MnH9K7GnHpyhNwYRVMWAwkTmKfhQCpfvN
